Logic

Class Action

  • java.lang.Object
    • Logic.Action

  • public class Action
extends java.lang.Object
    The class Action manages the possible actions available for the player to carry out.

    This class serves as a Factory Design Pattern for Actions. It's main objective is to give the client a way to create valid predefined actions.

    Version:
    v0.1 03/13/2014
    Author:
    Eduard de Torres

    • Constructor Detail

      • Action

        public Action()
        Creates a new undefined Action.

        Creating an Action with this method may generate a non valid action for the server.

      • Action

        public Action(java.lang.String type,
      int x,
      int y)
        Creates a new Action. The client may specify the action type and the coordinates to do this action.
        Parameters:
        type - type of action to create. This parameter may be filled with any of the action keywords (MOVE, PASS, SHOOT).
        x - x-coordinate to do this action.
        y - y-coordinate to do this action.

    • Method Detail

      • getMoveAction

        public static Action getMoveAction(int x,
                   int y)
        Creates a new MOVE Action.

        Returns a new Movement Action. The client must specify the coordinates where he wants to go. This coordinates will be converted into a unit vector movement to determine which neighboring grid will move. So it doesn't matter if the coordinates chosen represent a neighboring grid or not.

        Parameters:
        x - x-coordinate representing a grid.
        y - y-coordinate representing a grid
        Returns:
        movement Action to the coordinates x, y.

      • getPassAction

        public static Action getPassAction(int x,
                   int y)
        Creates a new PASS Action.

        Returns a new Pass Action. The client must specify the coordinates where he wants to pass the ball. This coordinates will represent the destination grid for the pass.

        Parameters:
        x - x-coordinate representing a grid.
        y - y-coordinate representing a grid
        Returns:
        pass Action to the coordinates x, y.

      • getShootAction

        public static Action getShootAction(int x,
                    int y)
        Creates a new SHOOT Action.

        Returns a new Shoot Action. The client must specify the coordinates where he wants to shoot the ball. This coordinates will represent the destination grid for the shoot.

        Parameters:
        x - x-coordinate representing a grid.
        y - y-coordinate representing a grid
        Returns:
        shoot Action to the coordinates x, y.

      • getAction_name

        public java.lang.String getAction_name()
        Returns the type of the Action.
        Returns:
        MOVE, PASS or SHOOT string.

      • getX

        public int getX()
        Returns the x-coordinate of the Action.
        Returns:
        x-coordinate of the Action.

      • getY

        public int getY()
        Returns the y-coordinate of the Action.
        Returns:
        y-coordinate of the Action.
